My brother saw a tactical opportunity to deprive me of the castling privilege -- but, as the Queens come off the board in the process, it will make it harder for him to exploit this with an attack. His Q will be gone and his Rooks stuck in the corners.

If he had played B-N5 ch, I was prepared to move my King again, but he elected this move instead. Now I seize a tactical chance to make his King remain exposed even if he does castle by breaking up his K-side Pawns.
